title: 109_hr3672
content: The Act titled "TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005" allows for advance payment of TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will pay TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006 immediately after the enactment of the Act. The Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program is extended through December 31, 2005, with necessary appropriations available for activities authorized under the Social Security Act. Grants and payments can continue into the first quarter of fiscal year 2006 at the same level as in fiscal year 2005. The amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to deadlines and funding allocations, extending the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority through December 31, 2005. Grants and payments may be made through the first quarter of fiscal year 2006 at the level provided for such activities through the first quarter of fiscal year 2005, with necessary appropriations authorized for fiscal year 2005. Reimbursement of states for TANF benefits provided to assist families affected by Hurricane Katrina. Beginning with the enactment of this Act until August 31, 2006, a State qualifies as needy for section 403(b) of the Social Security Act if they provide short-term, nonrecurring cash benefits to families affected by Hurricane Katrina who have relocated from a disaster-declared area. The State must confirm that the family is not receiving benefits from any other State program funded under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act limits the total amount paid to a needy State under section 403(b)(3)(A) to the cash benefits provided to families, subject to certain conditions. No State match is required for payments made under this section. SEC. 4. AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL TANF FUNDS FOR HURRICANE-DAMAGED STATES. Beginning with the date of the enactment of this Act and ending with the end of fiscal year 2006, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama are eligible for loans under the Social Security Act. The total loan amount for each state cannot exceed 20 percent of the State family assistance grant for fiscal year 2006. Any penalties for not repaying the loan or making interest payments are forgiven until October 1, 2007. SEC. 5 allows States or tribes to use unspent TANF funds to support needy families affected by Hurricane Katrina without fiscal year limitation. SEC. 6 states that temporary TANF benefits provided to families affected by the hurricane will not trigger work requirements or time limits. SEC. 7 waives TANF penalties in hurricane-damaged states. SEC. 7 waives TANF penalties in hurricane-damaged states, specifically Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama, due to Hurricane Katrina until the end of fiscal year 2006.
